com.complexible.stardog.api

Interface ReadQuery<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Query<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BooleanQuery, GraphQuery, SelectQuery

    public interface ReadQuery<T>
extends Query<T>

    A read-only query, ie a select, construct, graph or ask query.

    Since:
    2.0
    Version:
    2.2.1
    Author:
    Michael Grove

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static long NO_LIMIT
      Constant value used to specify that a query should not have any limit imposed on the number of results it returns.
      static long NO_OFFSET
      Constant value used to specify that a query has no offset in its query results

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ReadQuery<T> dataset(org.openrdf.query.Dataset theDataset)
      Specify the dataset this query will be executed against.
      ReadQuery<T> limit(long theLimit)
      Set the maximum number of results that can be returned by this query.
      ReadQuery<T> offset(long theOffset)
      Set the offset of the query results.
      ReasoningType reasoning()
      Return the reasoning level used by this query
      ReadQuery<T> reasoning(ReasoningType theReasoningType)
      Specify the type of reasoning you would like the query to be executed with.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.complexible.stardog.api.Query

        execute, explain, parameter, parameter, parameter, parameter, parameter, parameter, parameter, parameter, parameter, parameter, parameter, parameter, parameter, toString

    • Field Detail

      • NO_LIMIT

        static final long NO_LIMIT
        Constant value used to specify that a query should not have any limit imposed on the number of results it returns.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NO_OFFSET

        static final long NO_OFFSET
        Constant value used to specify that a query has no offset in its query results
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • limit

        ReadQuery<T> limit(long theLimit)
        Set the maximum number of results that can be returned by this query. Setting the limit on the query will override any limit specified in the original query string, however, setting the limit to NO_LIMIT will not remove the limit if it is specified in the query, but you can use it to remove a limit that has already been set if there was not a limit specified in the query originally.
        Parameters:
        theLimit - the new limit
        Returns:
        this query

      • offset

        ReadQuery<T> offset(long theOffset)
        Set the offset of the query results. Similar to limit(long) this will override an offset in the query, and you can use NO_OFFSET to remove an offset specified on the query, but not in the query string.
        Parameters:
        theOffset - the offset
        Returns:
        this query

      • reasoning

        ReadQuery<T> reasoning(ReasoningType theReasoningType)
        Specify the type of reasoning you would like the query to be executed with. You can only modify the reasoning level of a query outside of a transaction. If querying within a transaction you can only use the reasoning level associated with the connection.
        Parameters:
        theReasoningType - the reasoning type
        Returns:
        this query
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if attempting to change the reasoning level of the query inside of a transaction

      • reasoning

        ReasoningType reasoning()
        Return the reasoning level used by this query
        Returns:
        the reasoning level

      • dataset

        ReadQuery<T> dataset(org.openrdf.query.Dataset theDataset)
        Description copied from interface: Query
        Specify the dataset this query will be executed against. This defines the active graph for the query and will override anything specified within the query. Use Datasets.NO_DATASET
        Specified by:
        dataset in interface Query<T>
        Parameters:
        theDataset - the active graph dataset
        Returns:
        this query
        See Also:
        Datasets, ImmutableDataset
